intro: Zanthoxylum liukiuense, commonly known as the Ryukyu prickly ash, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Zanthoxylum liukiuense is notable for its thorny stems and its ability to thrive in coastal and limestone-rich soils. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
